comment: This class was terrible for my mental health. The tests were almost impossibly hard and he seemed to take pride in that fact. Was actively critical of student work but rarely gave constructive criticism. I worked as hard as I possibly could for this class and still consider it a miracle that I even passed. I do not recommend this prof.

If you're in AT you have to take him first semester, and the first day will shock you. He is very critical, and talks SO MUCH. He will often expect you to know things he hasn't talked about because he expects you to read the textbook. Read the abstract and try to "think outside the box". He is a funny little man, super passionate, and won't fail.

He is tuff but you learn a lot. Need to know how to draft correctly or you will learn how to really quickly. very detailed-oriented. nice guy but can seem tuff and intimidating at times. READ THE ABSTRACT IT WILL BE YOUR BFF. can do things didn't get done for final portfolio. take if you're serious and have a ton of time to dedicate to this class

I had a relaxed prof for ARCH1001, so Pittman's class was an extreme change. Comes off a bit harsh for reviews, but he does care about the work you're producing. Very passionate about good concepts. Make sure you attend class. Looks over all work at end of semester and you have a portfolio. Great for building up your arch skills and grit!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: His abstracts are insanely convoluted and he doesn't even know what he wants for each assignment. The workload is insanely difficult and none of his feedback is positive. He DOESN'T GIVES YOU GRADES until the end of the semester for some stupid reason. He expects you to always be working and never take a single break. In other words don't take him.

AKA Willie Pittman: I was a 4.0 student who put 40+ hrs into his studio every week. DO NOT TAKE! Condescending, laughs when you're wrong, won't tell you what's wrong, expects answers students don't know, constantly contradicts himself and changes criteria for projects. Disconnected from amnt of work assigned. Rude! No creative freedom. Uninspiring

Great first year professor for studio! He is in love with Architecture and loves to share his knowledge. He challenges you to improve your drafting skills and pushes you to be a better student. He loves give long speeches so be prepared. And just be ready to hear,  DID YOU READ THE ABSTRACT?!

He loves to answer questions, but beware because the answer is often cryptic and very long. He gives great advice and will help and guide you through the design process. Never worry about answering his questions "correctly", he just wants you to answer. Last few notes: read the abstract, he likes to joke around, and he is very blunt/frank.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: His assignment sheets are not clear. He gives extra credit but its mandatory. He gives very long boring lectures but you have to power through them to know whats going on. Don't take him unless you have to.
